description: Earth systems could be "tipped" into unstable states if warming overshoots the 1.5°C target, but impacts could be minimized if warming is swiftly reversed.
title: Climate risks from exceeding 1.5°C reduced if warming swiftly reversed, says study

description: In March 2023, temperatures in eastern Senegal soared to 40°C, with the cooling rains still months away. Yet, for the dedicated field team from the NGO Panthera—committed to global feline conservation—and the Direction des parcs nationaux du Sénégal (DPN) (Senegal National Parks team), led by Mouhamadou Ndiaye, the work continued unabated.
title: Giant pangolin rediscovered in Senegal

description: Ever since Polynesian pioneers took to the ocean on wooden rafts, people have been hooked on riding waves. Today, surfing is one of the world's fastest-growing sports and one of the latest additions to the Olympic games.
title: Save our waves: Surfing pumps $2.71 billion into the Australian economy and boosts well-being

description: U.S. Forest Service researchers and partners published new findings on how leaf-eating insects affect forest ecosystems worldwide.
title: New research sheds light on relationships between plants and insects in forest ecosystems

description: Opponents of deep sea mining suffered a serious setback Friday when they failed to take a first step toward an international moratorium on the controversial practice.
title: Deep sea mining opponents suffer major setback

description: In the lush jungle of northern Guatemala—in the largest protected area in Central America—30 leaders from Colombia's Amazon basin region are swapping strategies with local ethnic Maya farmers on how to live off this dense forest without destroying it.
title: Colombia, Guatemala learn from each other in rainforest preservation

description: Aerosol particles are tiny. Swirling suspended in the air around us, most are smaller than the smallest bug, thinner than the thinnest hair on your head, gossamer specks practically invisible to the naked eye. Newly formed ones are nano-sized. Yet their influence is gargantuan.
title: Born to modulate: Researchers reveal origins of climate-controlling particles
